intro: Streptanthus hesperidis, commonly known as the Sierra foothill silverspot, is a flowering plant native to California. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces white or pale yellow blooms. It is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
